title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
description: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message (1GD0L9O)
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard, a message appears at the top that states 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty. This message is confusing and unclear.
EB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' wizard and before typing anything, no message should appear at the top. The message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should only be displayed if the user enters a package name that matches an existing folder.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:                                                                                  
1. Create a new Java project.                                                                          
2. Select the project.                                                                                         
3. Invoke the 'New Java Package' wizard.
